goals.question: What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?
goals.visualization: Box plot of wheat prices by region
goals.rationale: A box plot will show the median, quartiles, and outliers of wheat prices in each region, allowing us to compare the distribution of prices across regions.

goals.question: How does the yield of wheat vary with respect to different soil types?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of yield vs. soil type
goals.rationale: A scatter plot will show the relationship between yield and soil type, allowing us to identify any patterns or correlations between the two variables.

goals.question: What is the trend in wheat production over time?
goals.visualization: Line chart of wheat production by year
goals.rationale: A line chart will show the trend in wheat production over time, allowing us to identify any patterns or changes in production over the years.

goals.question: What is the relationship between wheat prices and production?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of wheat prices vs. production
goals.rationale: A scatter plot will show the relationship between wheat prices and production, allowing us to identify any patterns or correlations between the two variables.

goals.question: What is the distribution of wheat quality across different regions?
goals.visualization: Box plot of wheat quality by region
goals.rationale: A box plot will show the median, quartiles, and outliers of wheat quality in each region, allowing us to compare the distribution of quality across regions.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.boxplot(x='region', y='price', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wheat prices across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['yield'] = pd.to_numeric(data['yield'], errors='coerce')
    sns.scatterplot(x='soil_type', y='yield', data=data)
    plt.title('How does the yield of wheat vary with respect to different soil types?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['Year'] = pd.to_datetime(data['Year'], format='%Y', errors='coerce')
    sns.lineplot(x='Year', y='Production', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the trend in wheat production over time?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['date'] = pd.to_datetime(data['date'], format='%Y-%m-%d', errors='coerce')
    sns.scatterplot(x='production', y='price', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the relationship between wheat prices and production?', wrap=True)
    return plt

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data['region'] = data['region'].astype('category')
    sns.boxplot(x='region', y='quality', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the distribution of wheat quality across different regions?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
